title: Student-Led Nursing Simulation Education: Geriatric Care Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic nursing theories and skills, foundational knowledge of elderly patient characteristics
context.additional_context: Simulation-based education replacing field training by utilizing smartphone applications as supplementary tools in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners will be able to identify at least three major health issues in elderly patients and explain corresponding nursing strategies.
Learners will apply patient-centered communication skills in a simulation environment with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners will demonstrate the ability to perform leadership roles and participate in decision-making within team-based scenarios.
Learners will conduct self-assessment and develop improvement plans through reflective journaling after nursing simulations.

resources: Geriatric Nursing Simulation Kit (sphygmomanometer, blood glucose monitoring model, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
